question: A server program requests and receives services from a client program.

In a packet switching network, assume that all packets have the same length and the queuing delay is ignored. Then, for a connection-oriented service, the connection setup time is always longer than the propagation time of a packet from the sender to the receiver.
Store-and-forward transmission means that the switch must receive the entire packet before it can begin to transmit the first bit of the packet onto the outbound link.
Each router has a forwarding table that maps destination addresses to outbound links.
IP is an end-to-end protocol.
When a data packet moves from the upper layer to the lower layers, headers are added.
IP is a connectionless protocol.
The total nodal delay is given by the sum of transmission delay and propagation delay.
A Web cache is both a server and a client at the same time.
FTP uses TCP as its underlying transport protocol.
SMTP transfers e-mail messages from one mail server to another mail server.
While HTTP is a push protocol, SMTP is a pull protocol.

The main task of the Internet's DNS is to provide a directory service that translates hostnames to IP addresses.
HTTP can use both non-persistent connections and persistent connections.
POP3 is a simple mail access protocol.
Socket is a hardware interface through which a process sends messages into, and receives messages from the network.
A transport-layer protocol can provide reliable data transfer only when the underlying network layer also provides reliable service.
Suppose Host A sends one TCP segment with sequence number 38 and 4 bytes of data over a TCP connection to Host B. In this same segment, the acknowledgement number is necessarily 42.
In Go-back-N, the sender is not allowed to transmit packets without waiting for an acknowledgement from the receiver.
A TCP sender window can only contain unacknowledged data.
When TCP is used, the TCP port number of the destination must be the same as the TCP port number of the source.
The size of the TCP announced receive window "rwnd" never changes throughout the duration of the connection.
The TCP protocol runs only in the end systems and not in the intermediate network elements during a communication session.
The TCP segment has a field in its header for "rwnd". This field limits throughput performance over a high-speed network.
Suppose Host A is sending a large file to Host B over a TCP connection. The number of unacknowledged bytes that A sends cannot exceed the size of the receiver buffer.

Routing is the network-wide process that determines the end-to-end paths that packets take from source to destination.
Queueing can happen at both the input ports and the output ports of a router.
In a datagram network, each time an end system wants to send a packet, it stamps the packet with the address of the destination end system and then sends the packet into the network.
Routers typically only look at the network part and not the host part of the IP address.
The IPv6 address space is much larger than the IPv4 address space.
Global routing algorithms use a complete graph of the network, with all the nodes and links.
Distance Vector routing algorithms are global routing algorithms.
NAT (Network Address Translation) has helped with postponing the running out of IPv4 addresses.

A hub is a physical-layer device that acts on individual bits rather than frames.

For the Internet, it is the job of the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) to translate between IP addresses and MAC addresses.

In CRC, the sender and the receiver must agree on the bit pattern of the generator.

The maximum propagation delay between any two nodes affects the efficiency of CSMA/CD. Specifically, the higher the delay, the lower the efficiency.
The maximum efficiency of slotted ALOHA is lower than the maximum efficiency of pure ALOHA.
